body.p: To his Excellency Govenor B Mogoffin

1
Your Petitioner would respectfully represent to your Honor that he has been engaged for some five months in selling goods of various kinds at auction in the City of Lexington; He states that he made no attempt to avoid the laws of the state in regard to auctioneers -- He employed a regularly licensed auctioneer to acution his good's & has regularly paid the percent both to the city and to the Commonwealth required by law -- these being the facts, he has been served with a warrant issuing from the City Court of Lexington charging him with selling with out License -- and further that he has been informed by Counsel that the Law may be against him wherefore he throws himself upon your Excellency's clemency -- and prays you to use your perogative in his case -- by a pardon before continuation --

2
Your Petition further states that he is a citizen of this Commonwealth and a resident of the City of Lexington; and making the above paragraph a part of this no 2 so far as it sets forth the facts -- he would state that he has been fined in the Lexington City Court for Pedling with out license -- when he never
claimed to be a Pedler or so considered himself having a large store rented in the City at which house all of his goods are sold at auctin by a regularly licensed auctioneer and he sells no goods through the county or City as a Pedler -- with those facts before the Jury -- under the law they were compelled to find him -- which they did to the amount of $100 --. Your Petition under the circumstances prays your Excellency to remit said fine except fees and costs
all of which your Petitioner respectfully submits
We the undersigned respectfully unite in the prayer's of the above petition

Parker Craig
James M. Lawrence
Theo Steele
M Fraser
Wm C P Breckenridge
Robt J Breckinridge
James B Beck
Thos W. Bullock
Z Gibbons

Peddling in their license
S J. Mossler
